value.title: Query Folding, DAX and a special day - Roundup #55
value.excerpt: Chris Webb looks at how to use Value.ResourceExpression() to see how Query Folding is working. Marco Russo looks at how to leverage INTERSECT. We look at a post geared towards consultants and how they can leverage Shared Dashboards in their work. Also, there was a special day last sunday and we recap

value.title: Roundup #30 (Service update, DAX in Report Builder, export and more)
value.excerpt: Catching up on the last two week. We had a big post regarding updates to the Power BI service. This included exporting data from a tile or report, adding images and textboxes, printing, connecting to SharePoint, pinning Excel charts, Power BI in Brazil and Hebrew/Arabic LTR support. value.title: Age Banding in Power BI Using TREATAS DAX Function   Relationship Based on Between
value.excerpt: One of the most common types of banding or binning is banding based on a range. Let's say, for example,¬† you want to have a group of customers based on their age group. The age group banding can be created in Power Query at the data transformation stage. It can be created using the Grouping and Binning

value.title: Basics of DAX Expression in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are a lot of resources about how to use each function. However, you always need to start with learning how the expression language works itself.
